page.title: 07FARMING AROUND HOLYWELL
page.content: The most populated area is situated near the town centre with the villages of Greenfield,Brynford,Carmel and Pant Asaph surrounding it.Within the area there are{several farms}but these are mainly{family concerns}and apart from a few which have youngsters on job creation,are not sources of employ- ment.The farms are{mainly sheep and {stock}with a few dairy farmers who deliver milk daily to homes and a {little arable}farming. A few years ago Holywell was a thriving market town with many animals wandering around the street on Monday market days and farm- ing families busily shopping for their weekly supplies.This market has now closed and all the pens have vanished. There is still an outdoor and indoor market with travelling salesmen set- ting up stalls Thursdays to Saturdays and a WI stall on Fridays.
